textos_fuente.text: About Us - Blue Wolf Tavern | Boardman, Ohio Restaurants About Us Menus All Day Menu Specials Lil Pup Menu Drink Menu Dessert Menu Party Tray Menu Carryout Cocktails News & Events Gallery Contact Contact Order Now Reservations Select Page About The Blue Wolf Tavern Blue Wolf Tavern is a farm-to-table eatery serving award-winning handcrafted recipes using homegrown ingredients envisioned by Executive Chef, Joe Rzonsa. Our menu is inspired by the culture and focus of locally-sourced ingredients and sustainable food. Along with gourmet food, you can eat, drink and converse in a cozy and comfortable environment inspired by the northern woods. In The Spirit Of The Wolf The wolf conjures up images of beauty and of fear, mystery and power. Their deep and mournful howls tell stories of long travels and cold, dark nights. There was a time when the wolf lived among us, envied by Native Americans for its ability to survive and thrive, protect its pack and be in balance with the world it shared. Wolves embrace a life of wild freedom. These highly socialized creatures carry themselves with certainty and pride, being friendly but never tame. Today, the wolf is an endangered species and resides mostly in Northwestern Canada and a few northwestern states in the United States. They still signify loyalty, success, perseverance, stability, thought and intuition. Our Story Great-tasting food using fresh and homegrown ingredients was the vision of Executive Chef, Joe Rzonsa. Blue Wolf Tavern first opened its doors in Struthers, Ohio in 2001 and quickly became a popular choice among patrons in Youngstown and the Mahoning Valley for its mouth-watering recipes, warm service and enjoyable atmosphere. Blue Wolf Tavern needed to expand and moved to its current location at 1295 Boardman-Canfield Road in Boardman, Ohio in 2004. The name, look and feel were the inspiration of a beautiful postcard of a wolf standing in front of burning woods, causing the wolf to have a bluish hue. The end result is a cozy dining experience filled with exceptional food made entirely from scratch. So come on in, sit down and enjoy a great meal! Blue Wolf Tavern 1295 Boardman-Canfield Rd. Boardman, OH 44512 330.726.1736 info@thebluewolftavern.com Navigation About Us Menus News & Events Gallery Tavern Hours Mon-Thu: 11:30am – 9pm Fri-Sat: 11:30am – 10pm Sun: 12pm – 8pm Lounge Open Late! is a new bar/venue in Midtown within easy walking distance from Levy and Lafayette Park neighborhoods. Serving beer, wine, coffee, tea, and sodas — a perfect quiet spot to enjoy conversation, reading, art, without TV or canned music. Now providing WiFi for customers. Menu offerings include soups and sandwiches prepared on the premises. Baked goods and snacks available. Parking available onsite, street-side or in public parking lots. Hours: Mon-Thu 5-midnight; Fri-Sat 4-1. Closed Sunday. Live music most nights. Acoustic blues Mondays. Occasional literary and film events. For booking, contact clhamby65@gmail.com or 850-264-6916 StarMetro bus stop next door: Big Bend line stops every 30 minutes A room full of people: Blue Tavern is a new bar/venue in Midtown within easy walking distance from Levy and Lafayette Park neighborhoods. Wheelchair Access OUR PARTNERS COCA's programs are sponsored in part by the City of Tallahassee, Leon County, the State of Florida, Department of State, Division of Cultural Affairs, Community Foundation of North Florida, Knight Foundation, National Endowment for the Arts, and the Tallahassee Community Redevelopment Agency. COCA, the Council on Culture & Arts, is a non-profit organization that serves as the facilitator and voice for the arts and cultural industry in Florida's capital area. COCA provides information and promotes the arts and culture to both citizens and visitors. ABOUT US DIRECTORIES CLASSIFIEDS PARTNERS CONTACT US 114 S DUVAL STREET TALLAHASSEE, FL 32301 LOCAL NUMBER: (850) 224-2500 EMAIL: info@tallahasseearts.org © Copyright 2025 - Council on Culture & Arts | Contact Us | Site Map | Privacy Policy Powered by ARTSOPOLIS The COCA office currently has adjusted office hours to 1 PM – 5 PM to accommodate pickup for Winterfest. These hours will be adjusted from Tuesday, February 11, through Friday, February 28 . Regular office hours will return on Monday, March 3. For questions, feel free to contact staff via phone or email. In addition, access to Railroad Avenue between Gaines Street & FAMU Way is down to one lane heading south. For access to the COCA office, please take Gaines Street as currently, the COCA office is not accessible off of FAMU Way.

Blue Canyon Kitchen & Tavern | Twinsburg, OH | About Us We're sorry but publication doesn't work properly without JavaScript enabled. Please enable it to continue. Our Philosophy The Adventures of the Blue Canyon At Blue Canyon, we strive to bring people together. Our award winning food will “entertain your tastebuds” and we accept nothing less than excellence from our team. It’s important to us that guests are treated like family by caring, thoughtful and warm people who are among the best in their fields. From the owners to the entire staff, everyone at Blue Canyon is held to the highest standards. They’re a friendly group, ready to meet your needs. Blue Canyon Kitchen and Tavern’s team invites you to enjoy the wonderful things life has to offer. Relax in our comfortable lodge setting while you sip martinis and settle in for a succulent meal prepared by our outstanding and creative chefs. After dessert, you’re just steps away from your evening accommodations with the Hilton Garden Inn Cleveland/Twinsburg. Indulge & Experience Escape from the everyday at Blue Canyon Kitchen & Tavern. Come indulge and experience all that Blue Canyon has to offer, from our unique vacation dining atmosphere and culture to our one of a kind, award-winning menu. It’s impossible not to sit back, laugh with friends and enjoy new twists on classic homemade dishes. Sitting atop a sandstone bluff that overlooks gorgeous views of wooded rolling landscapes of Northeast Ohio, Blue Canyon Restaurant offers an unparalleled rustic, cozy atmosphere. The restaurant’s design was inspired by the grand lodges located throughout the National Parks of the United States. Surrounded by hand-hewn cedar logs, soaring cathedral ceilings and multiple fieldstone fireplaces, you’re bound to step away from the daily stresses of life. Sit next to one of our breathtaking full window walls, as they provide dramatic views, or cozy up in our warm Kitchen Dining Room. The scenery and atmosphere of Blue Canyon Restaurant and Tavern complements the delectable and creative American Cuisine that our talented chefs create each night. Meet Our Management Bob Voelker CEO / President Val Voelker Principal Scott Coffman Director of Culinary / Executive Chef Private Dining & Catering Team Katie Stell Private Dining/Catering Director Ashley Bakewell Private Dining/Catering Coordinator Contact Us Today!
